DOC.brief_summary: This randomize controlled trial aim compare three group intravenous fluid impact labor : 1 ) 125 mL/hr 5 % dextrose normal saline 2 ) 250 mL/hr normal saline 3 ) 250 mL/hr 5 % dextrose normal saline
DOC.brief_title: Effects Rate and/or Presence Dextrose Labor Course Nulliparas
DOC.detailed_description: Currently , patient arrive labor delivery automatically receive IV fluid hydration part standard order set . The current default IV fluid order 125mL/hr 5 % dextrose , either normal saline lactate ringer . Any patient deliver first time present labor delivery active labor screen . If meet inclusion requirement offer enrollment . Subjects blindly randomize receive one three different type IV fluid : 1 . 5 % dextrose Normal saline ( Normal saline plus 5g/dl glucose ) 125 mL/hr ( current LBMMC default inpatient IV order set ) 2 . Normal saline ( solution contain sodium chloride ) 250 mL/hr 3 . 2.5 % dextrose Normal saline 125 mL/hr - Management labor discretion attend physician ( ) . - Maternal outcome measure include : 1 ) total amount IV fluid administer , 2 ) length labor , 3 ) epidural use , 4 ) oxytocin use , 5 ) mode delivery , 6 ) development maternal infection morbidity postpartum hemorrhage . - Neonatal outcome measure include : 1 ) birth weight , 2 ) Apgar score , 3 ) hospital course ( nursery placement length stay ) , 4 ) need treatment jaundice .
DOC.criteria: • Primiparous Singleton gestation Vertex presentation Spontaneous active labor without pitocin augmentation Gestational age > 36 week Cervical dilation 3 5 cm without rupture membrane • Multiparous Pregestational gestational diabetes mellitus Preeclampsia admission Previous cesarean section Nonvertex presentation Multiple gestation Chorioamnionitis admission Intrauterine growth restriction ( < 10th percentile ) Patients admitted induction BMI > 50
